Traits

A monster's traits, if any, are features that are active at all times or in certain situations.

Running a Monster

To ensure a monster acts in accordance with its Challenge Rating, follow these rules during combat:

Special Abilities. If the monster has a special ability that deals a lot of damage but has a limited number of uses, such as a recharging breath weapon or a spell it can cast only once per day, have it use that special ability as quickly and as often as possible.

Multiattack. If the monster has Multiattack, have it use Multiattack on any of its turns in which it's not using one of its more powerful abilities.

Bonus Actions, Reactions, Legendary Actions. If the monster has Bonus Actions, Reactions, or Legendary Actions in its stat block, make sure it uses them as often as it can.

Actions

A monster can take the actions in this section or take one of the actions available to all creatures, as described in the Player's Handbook.

Attack Notation

The entry for a monster's attack identifies whether the attack is a melee or a ranged attack and then provides the attack roll's bonus, its reach or range, and what happens on a hit. An attack is against one target unless its entry says otherwise. For details on different kinds of attacks, see the Player's Handbook.

Hit. Any damage dealt or other effects that occur as a result of an attack hitting a target are described after the “Hit:” notation.

Miss. If an attack has an effect that occurs on a miss, that information follows the “Miss:” notation.

Hit or Miss. If an attack has an effect that occurs regardless of whether it hits or misses its target, that information follows the “Hit or Miss:” notation.

Saving Throw Effect Notation

If an effect forces a saving throw, the effect identifies the kind of save required and then provides the save's DC, a description of which creatures make the save, and an explanation of what happens on a failed or successful save.

“Half damage only” on a successful save means the target takes half as much damage (round down) as targets that fail the save, while also ignoring all other parts of the effect.

Damage Notation

A stat block usually provides both a number and a die expression for each instance of damage. For example, an attack might deal 4 (1d4 + 2) damage on a hit. You decide whether to use the number or the die expression in parentheses; don't use both.

Multiattack

Some creatures can make more than one attack when they take the Attack action. Such creatures have the Multiattack entry in the “Actions” section of their stat block. This entry details the attacks a creature can make, as well as any additional abilities it can use, as part of the Attack action.

Spellcasting

If a monster can cast any spells, its stat block lists the spells and provides the monster's spellcasting ability, spell save DC (if any spells require a saving throw), and spell attack bonus (if any spells require an attack roll). Unless noted otherwise, a spell of level 1 or higher is always cast at its lowest possible level and can't be cast at a higher level.

A monster's spell can have special rules or restrictions. For example, a green slaad can cast the Invisibility spell, but the spell has a “self only” restriction, which means the spell affects only the slaad.

Spell Components. The Spellcasting trait notes whether the monster's spellcasting ignores the need for certain spell components. If any spell components are required, describe the monster's use of Verbal, Somatic, or Material components to signal to characters that it is casting a spell. A monster that requires Material components has them.

Casting Times of 1+ Minutes. If a spell has a casting time of 1 minute or more yet is listed in a spellcasting action, the monster doesn't cast the spell in just one action unless the action's description states otherwise; the monster must take the Magic action on each of its turns and maintain Concentration to cast the spell, as described in the Player's Handbook.

Bonus Action

If a monster has Bonus Action options, they are listed in this section. See the Player's Handbook for details on Bonus Actions.

Reactions

If the monster has Reaction options, those are listed in this section along with their triggers. See the Player's Handbook for details on Reactions.

Legendary Actions

If the monster has Legendary Action options, those are listed in this section. A Legendary Action is an action that a monster can take immediately after another creature's turn. Only one of these actions can be taken at a time and only after another creature's turn ends. The monster can't take a Legendary Action if it has the Incapacitated condition or is otherwise unable to take actions.

The monster has a limited number of Legendary Action uses, and that number is specified in the stat block. The monster expends one use whenever it takes a Legendary Action, and it regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Limited Usage

Some parts of a stat block have restrictions on the number of times they can be used. Here are the most common ways that usage is limited:

  • X/Day. This notation means the stat block part can be used a certain number of times (represented by X) and that a monster must finish a Long Rest to regain expended uses. For example, a Reaction that includes “1/Day” means the Reaction can be taken once and that the monster must finish a Long Rest to take it again.

  • Recharge X–Y. This notation means a monster can use the stat block part once. At the start of each of the monster's turns, roll 1d6. If the roll is within the number range given in the notation (represented by X–Y), the monster regains the use of that part, which also recharges when the monster finishes a Short or Long Rest. For example, “Recharge 5–6” in an action means a monster can take the action once. Then, at the start of each of the monster's turns, it regains the use of that action if it rolls a 5 or 6 on 1d6.

  • Recharge after a Short or Long Rest. This notation means the monster can use the stat block part once and must then finish a Short or Long Rest to use it again.

Appendix B.name: Appendix B
Appendix B.text:
This appendix provides conversions for stat blocks that have changed between the 2014 Monster Manual and this book, as well as lists of monsters organized by habitat, creature type, group, and Challenge Rating.

1.1.0.text:
Bug Fixes

  • All uses of deprecated attributes like "attributes.spelldc" have been updated to use "attributes.spell.dc".

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmEarthElemental]{Earth Elemental} now has darkvision and tremorsense.

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmPerformer00000]{Performer}'s wildcard path has been updated to no longer include Performer Legend tokens which are scaled differently. [#1028]

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmBaboon00000000]{Baboon}'s token image has been corrected to include a ring.

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmBeholder000000]{Beholder} token now uses the modern 2024 art.

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmFireElemental0]{Fire Elemental}'s token now uses the modern 2024 art. The subject was correct and has not been changed.

  • Many tokens now correctly use the wildcard to refer to their variants. Review the issue for a list of all creatures. [#984]

  • Corrected some spacing issues in the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAssassin000000]{Assasin}'s Multiattack description.

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmVampire0000000]{Vampire} now uses the correct tokens.

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAboleth0000000]{Aboleth}'s Tentacle attack now correctly deals 2d6 damage.

  • All "Small" sized creatures now have the correct token scaling of 1 as the system will automatically scale dynamic tokens to the correct size.

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmFlameskull0000]{Flameskull}'s token now emanates light as described in its Illumination feature.

  • Added a missing 'n' in nalfeshnee in the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmMonstersAtoZ00]{hezrou}'s description. [#1013]

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmMindFlayer0000]{Mind Flayer}'s tentacles now correctly includes the Grappled condition and related description. [#1011]

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmPriestAcolyte0]{Priest Acolyte}'s mace additional damage is now typed as "Radiant". [#1018, #991]

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmOchreJelly0000]{Ochre Jelly} now correctly summons Ochre Jelly's and not Black Puddings. [#1007, #992]

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmCockatrice0000]{Cockatrice}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmDarkmantle0000]{Darkmantle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmEagle000000000]{Eagle}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmSpinedDevil000]{Spined Devil} now have the correct token scaling.

  • Added missing text to the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAnkheg00000000]{Ankheg}'s Bite description. [#994]

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.features.Item.mmFireRay0000000]{Fire Ray} template feature no longer includes a +1. [#993]

  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmFlyingSnake000]{Flying Snake}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmGiantCentipede]{Giant Centipede}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmBloodHawk00000]{Blood Hawk} have had their scale corrected. [#988]

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmHalfdragon0000]{Half-Dragon}'s @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.features.Item.mmDraconicOrigin]{Draconic Origin} feature and the template item have both been updated to include a lightning resistance Active Effect and icon updates. [#985]

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmGladiator00000]{Gladiator}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmGoblinBoss0000]{Goblin Boss}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmGuard000000000]{Guard}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmGuardCaptain00]{Guard Captain}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmHelmedHorror00]{Helmed Horror}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmHobgoblinWarlo]{Hobgoblin Warlord}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmHobgoblinWarri]{Hobgoblin Warrior} now have their AC correctly reflected with their shields.

  • Removed the empty and unnecessary "Monster Traits" folder from the Roll Tables pack. [#976]

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmHobgoblinWarri]{Hobgoblin Warrior}'s token scaling is now correct. [#977]

  • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.features.Item.mmAnimateTrees00]{Animate Trees}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.features.Item.mmAnimatingSpore]{Animating Spores}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.features.Item.mmNeedles0000000]{Needles} features have been created and added to their actors (@UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmTreant00000000]{Treant}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmMyconidSoverei]{Myconid Sovereign}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmNeedleBlight00]{Needle Blight} respectively) .

  • The following creatures have had their Biographies updated: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientGreenDr]{Ancient Green Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAdultGreenDrag]{Adult Green Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAdultBlackDrag]{Adult Black Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientBlackDr]{Ancient Black Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAdultBlueDrago]{Adult Blue Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientBlueDra]{Ancient Blue Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAdultBrassDrag]{Adult Brass Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientBrassDr]{Ancient Brass Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAdultBronzeDra]{Adult Bronze Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientBronzeD]{Ancient Bronze Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAdultCopperDra]{Adult Copper Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientCopperD]{Ancient Copper Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAdultGoldDrago]{Adult Gold Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientGoldDra]{Ancient Gold Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAdultRedDragon]{Adult Red Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientRedDrag]{Ancient Red Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAdultSilverDra]{Adult Silver Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientSilverD]{Ancient Silver Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmSphinxOfValor0]{Sphinx of Valor}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmSphinxOfLore00]{Sphinx of Lore}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmVampire0000000]{Vampire}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmVampireUmbralL]{Vampire Umbral Lord}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAdultWhiteDrag]{Adult White Dragon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientWhiteDr]{Ancient White Dragon}

  • A variety of fixes [#991]:

    • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAboleth0000000]{Aboleth}'s tentacle attack has had its damage corrected.

    • The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmModronDuodrone]{Modron Duodrone}'s items have updated icons and the Clockwork Blade's attack/damage is now correct.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAdultBlueDrago]{Adult Blue Dragon}'s Rend and Lightning Breath attacks now deal the correct amount of damage.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientBlackDr]{Ancient Black Dragon}'s Rend attack now deals the correct damage.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientGreenDr]{Ancient Green Dragon}'s Rend and Poison Breath now deal the correct damage.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmYoungRedDragon]{Young Red Dragon} Fire Breath now deals the correct damage.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAdultCopperDra]{Adult Copper Dragon}'s Acid Breath now deals the correct damage.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientBrassDr]{Ancient Brass Dragon}'s Scorching Sand now deals the correct damage.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientCopperD]{Ancient Copper Dragon}'s Acid Breath now deals the correct damage.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmAncientGoldDra]{Ancient Gold Dragon}'s Rend and Fire Breath now deal the correct damage.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmYoungCopperDra]{Young Copper Dragon}'s Rend now deals the correct damage.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmMagmaMephit000]{Magma Mephit}'s Death Burst now deals the correct damage.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmCentaurTrooper]{Centaur Trooper}'s Trampling Charge now correctly uses the strength modifier.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmPixie000000000]{Pixie}'s Faerie Dust now includes 1 Radiant damage.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmLarva000000000]{Larva}'s Bite now has the correct damage type.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmSuccubus000000]{Succubus} now features the correct portraits/tokens.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmGlabrezu000000]{Glabrezu}'s Pincer and Pummel features now have the correct damage types. The template feature has also been updated.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmChainDevil0000]{Chain Devil}'s Unnerving Gaze now includes the correct DC.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmArchpriest0000]{Archpriest} now includes the Divine Aid bonus action.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmWarriorCommand]{Warrior Commander} now includes the Maneuver feature.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmWereboar000000]{Wereboar}'s tusk now has a damage type.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmGiantOctopus00]{Giant Octopus}'s tentacles attack now has the correct damage dice.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmGasSporeFungus]{Gas Spore Fungus}' tendril attack now has a damage type.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmMyconidSoverei]{Myconid Sovereign}'s @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.features.Item.mmAnimatingSpore]{Animating Spores} feature has been added and created as a template feature.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmNeedleBlight00]{Needle Blight}'s @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.features.Item.mmNeedles0000000]{Needles} has been added and created as a template feature.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmTreant00000000]{Treant}'s @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.features.Item.mmAnimateTrees00]{Animate Trees} feature has been added and created as a template feature.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmBanshee0000000]{Banshee}'s corrupting touch feature now has a damage type.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmCrawlingClaw00]{Crawling Claw}'s slam feature now has a damage type configured.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmGhost000000000]{Ghost}'s possession feature now has the correct saving throw.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmVampire0000000]{Vampire}'s Grave Strike attack now has the correct damage.

    • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmMinotaurOfBaph]{Minotaur of Baphomet}'s Gore feature now includes the correct dice in the description (the activity was already correct).
